title: [Large-Scale] Single-Atom Catalyst Design: Computational Optimization Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Knowledge of Basic Materials Science and Catalytic Engineering, with an Understanding of Computational Chemistry
context.additional_context: A course for practitioners to learn single-atom catalyst design methodologies applicable in industrial settings, conducted in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Explain computational methodologies for evaluating stability, activity, and selectivity of single-atom catalysts
Design workflows combining machine learning (gradient boosting) and DFT calculations to predict catalyst performance

Within one week, learners can analyze NRR performance data for Nx-based single-atom catalysts (V-Nx, Nb-Nx, Ta-Nx, etc.) and prepare a report under five pages comparing three metrics: ammonia production rate (μmol h⁻¹ g⁻¹), Faraday efficiency (%), and reaction stability (hours).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
